intro: Lippia fastigiata, commonly known as purpletop lippia, is a flowering plant native to the Americas. It is a member of the Verbenaceae family and is characterized by its upright growth habit and showy, violet-blue flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a slightly hairy texture, while its stems are erect and branching. Lippia fastigiata is often used in ornamental gardening for its attractive appearance and ability to attract pollinators.
